metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2325 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The compile_branch function in PCRE before 8.37 allows context-dependentattackers to compile incorrect code, cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds heap read and crash), or possibly have other unspecifiedimpact via a regular expression with a group containing a forward referencerepeated a large number of times within a repeated outer group that has azero minimum quantifier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2325` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
